author: ralexstokes
content:
>  I find that enforcing this in the case that the block does not make in on-chain because of the relay (as the other day) cannot be made trustless with a system like Mev Boost unless you're already doing some form of ePBS.
<@755590043632140352> my point is that whatever we need to do in "enshrined" PBS can be done in the EVM, especially after mainnet inclusion of EIP-2537 and EIP-4788

given both of these should be live upon pectra, it seems like we could start to work on an unconditional payment scheme today so that proposers can validate a 'trustless' payment along with getting a mev-boost bid, before they even sign over a particular `BlindedBeaconBlock`, and have it live in about a year's time

assuming builder and proposer adoption (doing it this way would incur EVM overhead and capital costs as builders would like need to be collateralized), then relays could stop having to verify proposer payment, reducing this one trust assumption

author: ralexstokes
content: it wouldn't be compatible w/ cancellations, but this is a non-trivial feature to implement in any ePBS

author: ralexstokes
content: one non-obvious piece is an on-chain builder registry (proposers are already on the CL and can be proven with 4788), although we are already moving in that direction with optimistic relaying and so its not a big step to bring it full circle

author: potuz
content:
> it wouldn't be compatible w/ cancellations, but this is a non-trivial feature to implement in any ePBS
This is a trivial feature to implement in ePBS, since the builder can become a relay, it can do whatever relays do right now with their own HTTP endpoint

author: potuz
content: I do agree though that we can have unconditional payment via the EVM, but this misses the point: ePBS is not about payment, ePBS is about removing a trust assumption, and I think we can have ePBS also in a years time

author: potuz
content: not for this year, but definitely for the next one
